content.question: Which of the following is the graph of <math alttext="open parentheses x minus 3 close parentheses squared over 4 minus open parentheses y minus 3 close parentheses squared over 1 equals 1"><mfrac><msup><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfenced><mn>2</mn></msup><mn>4</mn></mfrac><mo>-</mo><mfrac><msup><mfenced><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfenced><mn>2</mn></msup><mn>1</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></math> in the <math alttext="x y"><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></math>-plane?

choices.label: The x axis ranges from negative 6 to 12 in increments of 1. The y axis ranges from negative 2 to 7 in increments of 1. The curve consists of two symmetric sections. All coordinates are approximate. The left section of the curve enters the window at (negative 6.1 comma 7.5). The curve decreases from left to right, passing through (negative 3 comma 5.9) and (0 comma 4.2). The curve reaches the point (1 comma 3) and then changes directions. The curve decreases from right to left, passing through (0 comma 1.8) and (negative 3 comma 0.1). The curve exits the window at (negative 6.5 comma negative 1.6). The right section of the curve enters the top of the window at (12.2 comma 7.5). The curve decreases from right to left, passing through (9 comma 5.9) and (6 comma 4.2). The curve reaches the point (5 comma 3) and then changes directions. The curve decreases from left to right, passing through (6 comma 1.8) and (9 comma 0.1). The curve exits the window at (12.5 comma negative 1.6).

The x axis ranges from negative 2 to 8 in increments of 1. The y axis ranges from negative 5 to 8 in increments of 1. The curve consists of two symmetric sections. All coordinates are approximate. The left section of the curve enters the window at (0 comma 8.9) and then decreases from left to right through the point (1 comma 6.5). The curve reaches the point (2 comma 3) and then changes directions. The curve decreases from right to left, passing through (1 comma negative 0.5) and (0 comma negative 2.8). The curve exits the window at (negative 1.4 comma negative 5.5). The right section of the curve enters the window at (6 comma 8.9). The curve decreases from right to left, passing through (5 comma 6.5). The curve reaches the point (4 comma 3) and then changes directions. The curve decreases from left to right, passing through (5 comma negative 0.5) and (6 comma negative 2.9). The curve exits the window at (7.4 comma negative 5.9).

The x axis ranges from negative 2 to 8 in increments of 1. The y axis ranges from negative 4 to 10 in increments of 1. The curve consists of two symmetric sections. All coordinates are approximate. The top section of the curve enters the window at (negative 0.9 comma 10.9). The curve decreases through (0 comma 9.3) and (2 comma 5.9). The curve reaches the point (3 comma 5) and then changes directions. The curve increases through (4 comma 5.9) and (6 comma 9.3). The curve exits the window at (6.9 comma 10.9). The bottom section of the curve enters the window at (negative 0.9 comma negative 4.9). The curve increases through (0 comma negative 3.3) and (2 comma 0.2). The curve reaches the point (3 comma 1) and then changes directions. The curve decreases through (4 comma 0.2) and (6 comma negative 3.3). The curve exits the window at (6.9 comma negative 4.9).

The x axis ranges from negative 6 to 12 in increments of 1. The y axis ranges from negative 2 to 7 in increments of 1. The curve consists of two symmetric sections. All coordinates are approximate. The top section of the curve enters the window at (negative 5.7 comma 7.5). The curve decreases through (negative 3 comma 6.2) and (0 comma 4.8). The curve reaches the point (3 comma 4) and then changes directions. The curve increases through (6 comma 4.8) and (9 comma 6.2). The curve exits the window at (11.7 comma 7.5). The bottom section of the curve enters the window at (negative 6.5 comma negative 1.9). The curve increases through (negative 3 comma negative 0.1) and (0 comma 1.2). The curve reaches the point (3 comma 2) and then changes directions. The curve decreases through (6 comma 1.2) and (9 comma negative 0.1). The curve exits the window at (12.5 comma negative 1.9).

content.answer: The x axis ranges from negative 6 to 12 in increments of 1. The y axis ranges from negative 2 to 7 in increments of 1. The curve consists of two symmetric sections. All coordinates are approximate. The left section of the curve enters the window at (negative 6.1 comma 7.5). The curve decreases from left to right, passing through (negative 3 comma 5.9) and (0 comma 4.2). The curve reaches the point (1 comma 3) and then changes directions. The curve decreases from right to left, passing through (0 comma 1.8) and (negative 3 comma 0.1). The curve exits the window at (negative 6.5 comma negative 1.6). The right section of the curve enters the top of the window at (12.2 comma 7.5). The curve decreases from right to left, passing through (9 comma 5.9) and (6 comma 4.2). The curve reaches the point (5 comma 3) and then changes directions. The curve decreases from left to right, passing through (6 comma 1.8) and (9 comma 0.1). The curve exits the window at (12.5 comma negative 1.6).

unit.text: 4: Functions Involving Parameters, Vectors, and Matrices (Not assessed on the AP Exam)

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Construct equivalent graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations of functions that are useful in a given mathematical or applied context, with and without technology.
